name: Roy Moore
description: Former Alabama Chief Justice Roy Moore faced multiple allegations of sexual misconduct in 2017. Multiple women accused Moore of sexual assault when they were teenagers and he was in his 30s. The allegations first surfaced in November 2017 during his U.S. Senate campaign. Moore lost the special election to Democrat Doug Jones.

name: Dennis Hastert
description: Former Speaker of the House Dennis Hastert sexually abused high school students while working as a wrestling coach. He was convicted in 2016 of structuring bank withdrawals to evade currency reporting requirements, related to paying hush money to victims of his abuse. He received a 15-month prison sentence.

name: Joseph Russell Dendy
description: Cobb County GOP Chairman Joseph Russell Dendy pleaded guilty in 2017 to 13 charges including child molestation, enticing a child for indecent purposes, and aggravated sexual battery. He received a life sentence with 30 years to serve. The crimes occurred from 2004 to 2011. He was arrested in May 2016.

name: Ralph Shortey
description: Oklahoma state senator and Donald Trump's 2016 Oklahoma campaign chair Ralph Shortey was arrested in March 2017 after being found in a motel room with a 17-year-old boy. He pleaded guilty in 2017 to child sex trafficking and was sentenced to 15 years in federal prison in 2018.

name: Mark Foley
description: U.S. Representative Mark Foley (R-FL) resigned from Congress on September 29, 2006, after it was revealed he had sent sexually explicit instant messages and emails to teenage boys who had served as congressional pages. The scandal broke less than six weeks before the 2006 midterm elections.

name: Tim Nolan
description: Former Kentucky judge and Trump Campbell County campaign chair Tim Nolan pleaded guilty in 2018 to 21 counts including human trafficking and child sex trafficking involving 19 victims (7 minors). He was sentenced to 20 years in federal prison. He used his position and threatened victims with arrest unless they performed sex acts.

name: Blake Farenthold
description: U.S. Representative Blake Farenthold (R-TX) resigned from Congress in April 2018 after it was revealed he used $84,000 in taxpayer money to settle a sexual harassment lawsuit filed by his former communications director. The lawsuit alleged gender discrimination, sexual harassment, and creating a hostile work environment.

name: Donald Lukens
description: U.S. Representative Donald 'Buz' Lukens (R-OH) was convicted in 1989 of contributing to the delinquency of a minor after paying a 16-year-old girl $40 for sex. He was convicted again in 1996 on bribery and conspiracy charges related to his time in Congress and sentenced to 30 months in prison.

name: Dan Crane
description: U.S. Representative Dan Crane (R-IL) was censured by the House of Representatives on July 20, 1983, by a vote of 421-3 for having sex with a 17-year-old congressional page. He lost his re-election bid in 1984.

name: Edison Misla Aldarondo
description: Puerto Rico House Speaker Edison Misla Aldarondo was charged in 2002 with rape of a 17-year-old friend of his stepdaughter. He was convicted of attempted rape, sexual abuse of a minor, and four counts of lewd conduct for molesting his stepdaughter beginning when she was 9 years old. He was sentenced to 13 years in prison in 2004.

name: Mark A. Grethen
description: Republican businessman and activist Mark A. Grethen was convicted in 2001 of six counts of sex crimes involving children (two counts each of forcible sodomy, aggravated sexual battery, and indecent liberties with a child). He was sentenced to 26 years in prison. Shortly after conviction, he was briefly named 'Republican of the Year' in 2002 by the National Republican Congressional Committee. He was killed in prison in 2021.

name: Beverly Russell
description: Christian Coalition leader and South Carolina Republican Party official Beverly Russell admitted in 1988 to sexually molesting his stepdaughter Susan Smith beginning when she was 15 years old. The abuse continued for years. During Smith's 1995 murder trial, Russell testified about the abuse and urged the jury to spare her life, saying he bore responsibility for her actions.

name: Robert Bauman
description: U.S. Representative Robert Bauman (R-MD) was charged on October 3, 1980, with soliciting sex from a 16-year-old male prostitute. Despite being a staunch conservative who often criticized American morality, charges were dropped after he completed court-supervised rehabilitation. He lost his re-election bid in November 1980.

name: Stephen White
description: Reverend Stephen White, who preached against homosexuality and sexual promiscuity at Yale and other campuses, was convicted in 2003 of criminal solicitation to commit involuntary deviate sexual intercourse. He was arrested in June 2003 after offering $20 to a 14-year-old boy in West Chester, Pennsylvania, for permission to perform oral sex. He faced a minimum 3-year prison term.

name: Jon Matthews
description: Conservative talk show host Jon Matthews pleaded guilty in June 2004 to indecency with a child for exposing his genitals to an 11-year-old girl at his Sugar Land, Texas, home in October 2003. He initially received deferred adjudication but his probation was revoked in 2007 after violations, and he was sentenced to 3 years in prison.

name: Howard Scott Heldreth
description: Anti-abortion and anti-gay activist Howard Scott Heldreth was charged in 1992 with rape and kidnapping of a 16-year-old girl. He pleaded guilty to sexual battery and was sentenced to probation and required to register as a sex offender in Florida.

name: Strom Thurmond
description: U.S. Senator Strom Thurmond had sex with Carrie Butler, a 15-year-old Black housemaid working for his family, when he was 22 years old in 1925. Their daughter, Essie Mae Washington-Williams, was born in October 1925. Thurmond, who became known for pro-segregation politics, kept his daughter's existence secret until after his death in 2003.

name: Peter Dibble
description: Connecticut legislator and Stonington first selectman Peter Dibble pleaded no contest in 2004 to having an inappropriate relationship with a 13-year-old girl. He was charged with repeated acts of sexual misconduct with the girl starting when she was 10 years old, including French-kissing her on at least 40 occasions.

name: Andrew Buhr
description: Republican politician and Missouri House candidate Andrew Buhr was charged in 2002 with two counts of first-degree sodomy with a 13-year-old boy. He was appointed by President Bush to the Commission on Presidential Scholars in November 2002 but lost the position within a month when the charges were filed. A mistrial was declared in January 2004 after he claimed he thought the boy was older.

name: Keith Westmoreland
description: Tennessee state representative and former Sullivan County executive Keith Westmoreland was arrested in 2002 on seven felony counts of lewd and lascivious exhibition to girls under age 16. He exposed his genitals to children at a hotel pool in Sandestin, Florida. He later committed suicide.

name: John Allen Burt
description: Anti-abortion activist and Christian fundamentalist John Allen Burt was arrested in 2003 for molesting a 15-year-old girl living at his shelter 'Our Father's House.' He was convicted on April 1, 2004, of five counts of lewd and lascivious molestation and conduct. He was sentenced to 18 years in prison and died while serving his sentence in 2013.

name: Keola Childs
description: Hawaii County Councilman Keola Childs pleaded guilty in 2000 to first-degree sexual assault for molesting a male child. The charge carried a possible sentence of 20 years in prison.

name: Parker J. Bena
description: Republican activist Parker J. Bena was a presidential elector for George W. Bush in 2000. In 2001, he pleaded guilty to possession of child pornography, including images of children as young as 3 years old, on his home computer. He was sentenced to 30 months in federal prison and fined $18,000.

name: Richard A. Dasen Sr.
description: Montana businessman and Republican benefactor Richard A. Dasen Sr. was convicted in May 2005 of promotion of prostitution, sexual abuse of children, and multiple felony prostitution counts. He paid women and girls for sex, took sexual photographs of girls under 18, and had sex with a 15-year-old girl. He was sentenced to 20 years with 18 suspended in September 2005.

name: Randall Casseday
description: Washington Times HR Director Randall Casseday was arrested on September 29, 2006, for attempting to entice a minor on the Internet. He instigated an online chat with what he believed was a 13-year-old girl (actually an undercover DCPD detective). After sexually explicit conversations and photo exchanges, he went to meet the 'girl' and was arrested.

name: Lou Beres
description: Oregon Christian Coalition chairman Lou Beres admitted in 2006 to sexually touching multiple girls when they were minors. He confessed to police that he molested a 13-year-old girl and touched a 16-17-year-old friend of his daughter in 1976-77. Three women came forward in 2005. No charges were filed due to statute of limitations, but he was sued in civil court.

name: Larry Dale Floyd
description: Denton County, Texas, Republican Constable Larry Dale Floyd was arrested in July 2005 for soliciting sex with an 8-year-old girl. He drove to Fremont County, Colorado, to meet a woman he thought would offer him her daughter. He faced charges of soliciting child prostitution, enticement of a child, and attempted sexual assault. He was sentenced in 2016.

name: Bobby Stumbo
description: Robert 'Bobby' Stumbo, Republican Party chairman of Floyd County, Kentucky, was arrested in 2005 and charged with sexual abuse involving a 5-year-old boy. The case was reported in the Lexington Herald-Leader on October 4, 2005.

name: Armando Tebano
description: Schenectady County Republican Chairman and county elections commissioner Armando Tebano pleaded guilty in February 2007 to harassment in connection with allegations he molested a 14-year-old girl at his home. He was sentenced to 250 hours community service and fined $295. The plea was a reduction from original charges of sexual abuse and forcible touching.

name: Nicholas Morency
description: Republican anti-abortion activist Nicholas Morency pleaded guilty in 2001 to possessing child pornography on his computer. In 1999, he used his home computer to set up a website offering $1.5 million to anyone who would kill an abortion provider. He was from Villas, New Jersey.

name: Randal David Ankeney
description: Republican activist and volunteer coordinator for Governor Bill Owens' reelection campaign Randal David Ankeney was convicted in 2001 of attempting to sexually assault a 13-year-old girl he met online. He was sentenced to 2 years in prison. In 2006, he faced additional charges involving a 14-year-old girl and was sentenced to 8 more years.

name: Dennis Rader
description: Dennis Rader, the BTK serial killer, was arrested on February 25, 2005. He was a Park City compliance supervisor, Boy Scout leader, and was elected president of Christ Lutheran Church council in January 2005. He murdered 10 people between 1974 and 1991. He served on the county zoning board and animal control advisory board.

name: Carey Lee Cramer
description: GOP advertising consultant Carey Lee Cramer created anti-Gore ads and used his 9-year-old stepdaughter in a 2000 Republican commercial. He was arrested in 2005 and convicted in 2006 of aggravated sexual assault of a child, two counts of indecency with a child by contact, and indecency with a child by exposure. The case was in McAllen/Mercedes, Texas.

name: Jim Knoblach
description: Minnesota state Representative Jim Knoblach, eight-term Republican and chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, ended his re-election campaign in September 2018 after his daughter publicly accused him of inappropriately touching her from age 9 to 21. Police investigated in 2017 but declined to file charges citing insufficient evidence.

name: Russell Harding
description: Russell Harding, president of the New York City Housing Development Corp (appointed by Mayor Giuliani), pleaded guilty in March 2005 to embezzlement and possession of child pornography. He was sentenced to the maximum of 63 months in federal prison in July 2005. He was initially arrested in 2003.

name: John David Roy Atchison
description: Assistant U.S. Attorney John David Roy Atchison was arrested on September 16, 2007, at Detroit airport in an FBI sting operation. He had chatted online for two weeks with an undercover detective posing as a mother offering her 5-year-old daughter. He was charged with enticement of a minor and traveling to have sex with someone under 12. He committed suicide by hanging in his Michigan prison cell three weeks later.

name: E. Ozwald Balfour
description: E. Ozwald Balfour, chairman of the Utah Republican Black Assembly and host of 'Talk of the Town' radio show on KTKK, was arrested in February 2005 and charged with four felony counts of forcible sex abuse. About a dozen women came forward with complaints about abuse during job interviews at his Media and Entertainment Studio. His radio show was pulled off the air.

name: John Bryan
description: St. Petersburg City Council Chairman John Bryan resigned and committed suicide on September 7, 2007, as police investigated allegations he sexually abused his two adopted daughters, ages 12 and 15. He inhaled carbon monoxide in his garage hours after resigning. He was first elected to council in 2001 and re-elected in 2005.

name: Garrett Ventry
description: Senate Judiciary Committee communications aide Garrett Ventry resigned in September 2018 while coordinating GOP messaging on Brett Kavanaugh's Supreme Court nomination. He faced past sexual harassment allegations from when he worked for NC House Majority Leader John Bell. He was employed by CRC Public Relations on leave to the committee.

name: Larry Corrigan
description: Larry Corrigan, financial director of King County Prosecuting Attorney's Office and bookkeeper for Prosecutor Norm Maleng's campaign, pleaded guilty in March 2007 to attempted child molestation and communicating with a minor for immoral purposes. He tried to arrange sex with an undercover officer posing as a 13-year-old girl. He was sentenced to 23 months in prison and accused of embezzling $70,000 from campaign funds.

name: Scott Eller Cortelyou
description: Radio host Scott Eller Cortelyou was arrested in January 2007 for using the Internet to lure a child. He engaged in sexually explicit chats with an undercover officer posing as a 12-year-old girl. He pleaded guilty in April 2007 to Internet luring and attempted Internet sexual exploitation of a child. He was sentenced to 18 months intensive probation and required to register as a sex offender. He hosted 'Business for Breakfast' on KRCN 1060-AM.

name: Brian Doyle
description: Department of Homeland Security Deputy Press Secretary Brian Doyle was arrested on April 4, 2006, for seducing what he thought was a 14-year-old girl (actually an undercover sheriff's deputy). He revealed his DHS employment and phone numbers during online sexual conversations. He was charged with 23 felony counts and sentenced on November 17, 2006, to 5 years in prison with 10 years probation. Released January 15, 2011.

name: Matthew Joseph Elliott
description: Republican campaign official and former Romney Iowa presidential campaign staffer Matthew Joseph Elliott was convicted in 2006 of sexual exploitation of a child. He was arrested in April 2006 and pleaded guilty three months later. He briefly worked for Governor Mitt Romney's campaign before leaving to run for Iowa state legislature.

name: Donald Fleischman
description: Brown County Wisconsin Republican Party Chairman Donald Fleischman was charged in September 2007 with child enticement, contributing to delinquency of a child, and exposing his genitals. Police found a 16-year-old boy hiding in his closet in November 2006. Charges were dropped then refiled in February 2008. He stepped down as county GOP chair and the party disbanded after it couldn't find new leadership.

name: Michael Flory
description: Republican Michael Flory, former head of the Michigan chapter of Young Americans for Freedom, raped a college student in 2019. The incident occurred while he was a prominent conservative activist on college campuses.

name: Richard Gardner
description: Nevada State Representative Richard Gardner (R) admitted to molesting his two daughters, including when they were toddlers. The abuse occurred over many years. He was convicted in 2002.
